Resources.Source: or
Resources.Translation: or

Resources.Source:
<script language="javascript">
var ECS_ViewType=2;

 //=============================================================================
 //  Handles calls to detach an attached file.  The id of this question will
 //  be sent in the hidDetach field.   At the server end, if this value is
 //  non-zero, then there is a file to be detached..

function OnDetach( attachmentId )
{
	// attachmentId is of the form <interactionId>*A*<attachmentOrdinal>

	var oForm = document.forms["frmPage"];
	oForm.elements["hidDetach"].value = attachmentId;
	oForm.submit();
}
</script>
Resources.Translation:
<script language="javascript">
var ECS_ViewType=2;

 //=============================================================================
 //  Handles calls to detach an attached file.  The id of this question will
 //  be sent in the hidDetach field.   At the server end, if this value is
 //  non-zero, then there is a file to be detached..

function OnDetach( attachmentId )
{
	// attachmentId is of the form <interactionId>*A*<attachmentOrdinal>

	var oForm = document.forms["frmPage"];
	oForm.elements["hidDetach"].value = attachmentId;
	oForm.submit();
}
</script>

Resources.Source:
<script language="javascript" type="text/javascript">
var ECS_ViewType=6;

function mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces(val)
{
	return (Math.round( val * 100 ) / 100);
}

function mlc_CultureStringToDouble(score)
{
	var re = new RegExp( "^[\\+\\-]?[0-9]*(\\x<%=DecimalSeparatorHex%>)?[0-9]*$" );
	var check = score.match(re);
	if( check == null ) return NaN;
	else return parseFloat(score.replace( "<%=DecimalSeparator%>", "." ));
}

function mlc_DoubleToCultureString(dbl)
{
	// convert a double into a string, using the supplied decimal separator.
	return dbl.toString(10).replace( ".", "<%=DecimalSeparator%>" );
}

function mlc_ValidateScore(itemscore)
{
	var score = itemscore.value.replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g, "");
	var scoreAsFloat = mlc_CultureStringToDouble(score);
	if( isNaN(scoreAsFloat) || scoreAsFloat < -1000 || scoreAsFloat > 1000 )
	{
		if( score != "" )
		{
			alert(<%=ScoreOutOfRange%>); 
			setTimeout( "document.forms[\"<%=FormId%>\"].elements[\"" + itemscore.id + "\"].select()", 1 );
			return false;
		}
	}
	else
	{
		itemscore.value = mlc_DoubleToCultureString(mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces( scoreAsFloat ));
		return true;
	}
}

function mlc_ValidateComment(commentField)
{
    if( commentField.innerText.length > <%=MaxCommentLength%> )
    {
        alert(<%=CommentTooLong%>);
        setTimeout( "document.forms[\"<%=FormId%>\"].elements[\"" + commentField.id + "\"].select()", 1 );
        return false;
    }
    else
    {
        return true;
    }
}

function mlc_RubricClick(checkbox, itemscoreName)
{
	// increment or decrement the corresponding ITEMSCORE.  Note that a blank ITEMSCORE is the same as 0.
	var scoreTextBox = document.forms["<%=FormId%>"].elements[itemscoreName];
	var scoreAsFloat = mlc_CultureStringToDouble(scoreTextBox.value);
	var deltaScoreAsFloat = mlc_CultureStringToDouble(checkbox.value);
	if( isNaN(scoreAsFloat) ) scoreAsFloat = 0;
	if( isNaN(deltaScoreAsFloat) ) deltaScoreAsFloat = 0;
	if( checkbox.checked )
	{
		scoreTextBox.value = mlc_DoubleToCultureString(mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces(scoreAsFloat + deltaScoreAsFloat));
	}
	else
	{
		scoreTextBox.value = mlc_DoubleToCultureString(mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces(scoreAsFloat - deltaScoreAsFloat));
	}
	scoreTextBox.select();
}
</script>
Resources.Translation:
<script language="javascript" type="tekst/javascript">
var ECS_ViewType=6;

function mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces(val)
{
	return (Math.round( val * 100 ) / 100);
}

function mlc_CultureStringToDouble(score)
{
	var re = new RegExp( "^[\\+\\-]?[0-9]*(\\x<%=DecimalSeparatorHex%>)?[0-9]*$" );
	var check = score.match(re);
	if( check == null ) return NaN;
	else return parseFloat(score.replace( "<%=DecimalSeparator%>", "." ));
}

function mlc_DoubleToCultureString(dbl)
{
	// convert a double into a string, using the supplied decimal separator.
	return dbl.toString(10).replace( ".", "<%=DecimalSeparator%>" );
}

function mlc_ValidateScore(itemscore)
{
	var score = itemscore.value.replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g, "");
	var scoreAsFloat = mlc_CultureStringToDouble(score);
	if( isNaN(scoreAsFloat) || scoreAsFloat < -1000 || scoreAsFloat > 1000 )
	{
		if( score != "" )
		{
			alert(<%=ScoreOutOfRange%>); 
			setTimeout( "document.forms[\"<%=FormId%>\"].elements[\"" + itemscore.id + "\"].select()", 1 );
			return false;
		}
	}
	else
	{
		itemscore.value = mlc_DoubleToCultureString(mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces( scoreAsFloat ));
		return true;
	}
}

function mlc_ValidateComment(commentField)
{
    if( commentField.innerText.length > <%=MaxCommentLength%> )
    {
        alert(<%=CommentTooLong%>);
        setTimeout( "document.forms[\"<%=FormId%>\"].elements[\"" + commentField.id + "\"].select()", 1 );
        return false;
    }
    else
    {
        return true;
    }
}

function mlc_RubricClick(checkbox, itemscoreName)
{
	// increment or decrement the corresponding ITEMSCORE.  Note that a blank ITEMSCORE is the same as 0.
	var scoreTextBox = document.forms["<%=FormId%>"].elements[itemscoreName];
	var scoreAsFloat = mlc_CultureStringToDouble(scoreTextBox.value);
	var deltaScoreAsFloat = mlc_CultureStringToDouble(checkbox.value);
	if( isNaN(scoreAsFloat) ) scoreAsFloat = 0;
	if( isNaN(deltaScoreAsFloat) ) deltaScoreAsFloat = 0;
	if( checkbox.checked )
	{
		scoreTextBox.value = mlc_DoubleToCultureString(mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces(scoreAsFloat + deltaScoreAsFloat));
	}
	else
	{
		scoreTextBox.value = mlc_DoubleToCultureString(mlc_RoundTwoDecimalPlaces(scoreAsFloat - deltaScoreAsFloat));
	}
	scoreTextBox.select();
}
</script>

Resources.Translation: The node <{0}> can not be found in the correct namespace. Extra information:{1}

Resources.Source: The value is an invalid URI.
Resources.Translation: The value is an invalid URI.

Resources.Source: A default value of "{0}" has been used in place of the missing or erroneous value for the <{1}> element's "{2}" attribute.
Resources.Translation: A default value of "{0}" has been used in place of the missing or erroneous value for the <{1}> element's "{2}" attribute.

Resources.Source: The value is an invalid xml:base. xml:base must be a valid URI that does not begin with a "/" but does end with a "/".
Resources.Translation: The value is an invalid xml:base. xml:base must be a valid URI that does not begin with a "/" but does end with a "/".

Resources.Source: The referencedObjective attribute on the {0} node is whitespace only, which is invalid. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.3.1.1.1.
Resources.Translation: The referencedObjective attribute on the {0} node is whitespace only, which is invalid. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.3.1.1.1.

Resources.Source: The node <{0}> has a value that starts with "{1}" that is too long.
Resources.Translation: The node <{0}> has a value that starts with "{1}" that is too long.

Resources.Source: The full XML of the parent node is: {0}
Resources.Translation: The full XML of the parent node is: {0}

Resources.Source: The value of the <{0}> element's "{1}" attribute is missing or erroneous.
Resources.Translation: The value of the <{0}> element's "{1}" attribute is missing or erroneous.

Resources.Source: The <ruleAction> node may occur 1 and only 1 time within a <preConditionRule>, <postConditionRule>, or <exitConditionRule>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.3.1.2.
Resources.Translation: The <ruleAction> node may occur 1 and only 1 time within a <preConditionRule>, <postConditionRule>, or <exitConditionRule>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.3.1.2.

Resources.Source: The parent node is {0}.
Resources.Translation: The parent node is {0}.

Resources.Translation: The <rollupCondition> node can only appear once in the <rollupRule> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.1.

Resources.Source: The node <{0}> has a value that is too long. It has been truncated to "{1}".
Resources.Translation: The node <{0}> has a value that is too long. It has been truncated to "{1}".

Resources.Source: The parent node, {0}, must represent a SCO.
Resources.Translation: The parent node, {0}, must represent a SCO.

Resources.Source: The value is not one of the permitted token values.
Resources.Translation: The value is not one of the permitted token values.

Resources.Source: The full XML of the erroneous node is: {0}
Resources.Translation: The full XML of the erroneous node is: {0}

Resources.Source: The file, {0}, referenced by the location element inside of metadata in the manifest can not be found in the package.
Resources.Translation: The file, {0}, referenced by the location element inside of metadata in the manifest can not be found in the package.

Resources.Source: The package is a multiple learning resource package, which is not supported.
Resources.Translation: The package is a multiple learning resource package, which is not supported.

Resources.Source: The node <{0}> can not be found in the correct namespace An attempt will be made to find a child node with that name in other namespaces. Extra information:{1}
Resources.Translation: The node <{0}> can not be found in the correct namespace An attempt will be made to find a child node with that name in other namespaces. Extra information:{1}

Resources.Source: The <rollupAction> node can only appear once in the <rollupRule>node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.3.
Resources.Translation: The <rollupAction> node can only appear once in the <rollupRule>node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.3.

Resources.Source: The value is not the expected type.
Resources.Translation: The value is not the expected type.

Resources.Source: The value of the <{0}> element is missing or erroneous.
Resources.Translation: The value of the <{0}> element is missing or erroneous.

Resources.Source: The value of the PageID attribute of the {0} element is invalid. The element has been omitted from the conversion.
Resources.Translation: The value of the PageID attribute of the {0} element is invalid. The element has been omitted from the conversion.

Resources.Source: The file {0} is not a valid file type.
Resources.Translation: The file {0} is not a valid file type.

Resources.Source: An element, <{0}>, is invalid because it is illegal or has illegal attribute values. Extra information: {1}
Resources.Translation: An element, <{0}>, is invalid because it is illegal or has illegal attribute values. Extra information: {1}

Resources.Source: The "{0}" portion of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}> contains invalid URI characters. These have been converted into valid characters automatically. The new value is "{3}". Extra information: {4}.
Resources.Translation: The "{0}" portion of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}> contains invalid URI characters. These have been converted into valid characters automatically. The new value is "{3}". Extra information: {4}.

Resources.Source: The <title> node is required on the {0} node in Content Aggregation manifests. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.10, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.2.1.
Resources.Translation: The <title> node is required on the {0} node in Content Aggregation manifests. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.10, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.2.1.

Resources.Source: Remote content is not supported.
Resources.Translation: Remote content is not supported.

Resources.Source: This learning resource requires a license and licensed Learning Resources are not supported.
Resources.Translation: This learning resource requires a license and licensed Learning Resources are not supported.

Resources.Source: The value of the <prerequisites> type attribute must be "aicc_script".
Resources.Translation: The value of the <prerequisites> type attribute must be "aicc_script".

Resources.Source: A default value of "{0}" has been used in place of the missing or erroneous value for the <{1}> element.
Resources.Translation: A default value of "{0}" has been used in place of the missing or erroneous value for the <{1}> element.

Resources.Source: The node <{0}> has a value that starts with "{1}" that is too long for the "{2}" attribute.
Resources.Translation: The node <{0}> has a value that starts with "{1}" that is too long for the "{2}" attribute.

Resources.Source: The <item> node must have an identifier attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.9, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.2.
Resources.Translation: The <item> node must have an identifier attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.9, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.2.

Resources.Source: An Activity node is required for content used in Microsoft Learning Components.
Resources.Translation: An Activity node is required for content used in Microsoft Learning Components.

Resources.Source: The value that begins with "{0}" of the node, <{1}>, is longer than the smallest permitted maximum (SPM), {2}.
Resources.Translation: The value that begins with "{0}" of the node, <{1}>, is longer than the smallest permitted maximum (SPM), {2}.

Resources.Source: The value "{0}" of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}>, is an invalid value. Extra information: {3}
Resources.Translation: The value "{0}" of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}>, is an invalid value. Extra information: {3}

Resources.Source: The value "{0}" of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}>, is an invalid value. It has been replaced by the default value "{3}". Extra information: {4}
Resources.Translation: The value "{0}" of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}>, is an invalid value. It has been replaced by the default value "{3}". Extra information: {4}

Resources.Source: The value that begins with "{0}" of the attribute, {1}, is longer than that supported by Microsoft Learning Components. Extra information: {2}
Resources.Translation: The value that begins with "{0}" of the attribute, {1}, is longer than that supported by Microsoft Learning Components. Extra information: {2}

Resources.Source: A <manifest> node in the correct namespace is required.
Resources.Translation: A <manifest> node in the correct namespace is required.

Resources.Source: A manifest is required and is not present in the package.
Resources.Translation: A manifest is required and is not present in the package.

Resources.Source: The value of the PageID attribute, {0}, on a <Page> element is used more than once. PageID's must be unique for each <Page> element.
Resources.Translation: The value of the PageID attribute, {0}, on a <Page> element is used more than once. PageID's must be unique for each <Page> element.

Resources.Source: The <resource> node must have an identifier attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.21, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.4.1.
Resources.Translation: The <resource> node must have an identifier attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.21, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.4.1.

Resources.Source: The node <{0}> has a value that is too long for the "{1}" attribute. It has been truncated to "{2}".
Resources.Translation: The node <{0}> has a value that is too long for the "{1}" attribute. It has been truncated to "{2}".

Resources.Source: (empty string)
Resources.Translation: (empty string)

Resources.Source: In multiple <mapInfo> nodes, true values are restricted. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.7.1.2.
Resources.Translation: In multiple <mapInfo> nodes, true values are restricted. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.7.1.2.

Resources.Source: The referenced node can not be found.
Resources.Translation: The referenced node can not be found.

Resources.Source: The value must be 0 or a positive integer.
Resources.Translation: The value must be 0 or a positive integer.

Resources.Source: A resource that belongs to an activity must have a type attribute set to "webcontent", an adlcp:scormType attribute set to "sco" or "asset", and a valid href attribute. {0}
Resources.Translation: A resource that belongs to an activity must have a type attribute set to "webcontent", an adlcp:scormType attribute set to "sco" or "asset", and a valid href attribute. {0}

Resources.Source: If an <item> element is a parent element, the <item> may not reference a <resource>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.9. The full XML of the node is: {0}
Resources.Translation: If an <item> element is a parent element, the <item> may not reference a <resource>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.9. The full XML of the node is: {0}

Resources.Source: The <rollupCondition> node must have a condition attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.2.
Resources.Translation: The <rollupCondition> node must have a condition attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.2.

Resources.Source: The <ruleConditions> node can only appear once in the <{0}> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.3.1.1.
Resources.Translation: The <ruleConditions> node can only appear once in the <{0}> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.3.1.1.

Resources.Source: In a list of <objectives>, there must be one and only one <primaryObjective> node.
Resources.Translation: In a list of <objectives>, there must be one and only one <primaryObjective> node.

Resources.Source: There are multiple instances of element, <{0}>. All but the first are ignored. Extra information:{1}
Resources.Translation: There are multiple instances of element, <{0}>. All but the first are ignored. Extra information:{1}

Resources.Source: The identifier is not a valid xs:ID.
Resources.Translation: The identifier is not a valid xs:ID.

Resources.Source: The <minNormalizedMeasure> node can only appear once in the <{0} objectiveID="{1}"> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.7.1.1.
Resources.Translation: The <minNormalizedMeasure> node can only appear once in the <{0} objectiveID="{1}"> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.7.1.1.

Resources.Source: An Organization node is required for content used in Microsoft Learning Components.
Resources.Translation: An Organization node is required for content used in Microsoft Learning Components.

Resources.Source: The duplicate nodes share the same {0} value, "{1}". The values must be different.
Resources.Translation: The duplicate nodes share the same {0} value, "{1}". The values must be different.

Resources.Source: This package could not be opened. More information: {0}
Resources.Translation: This package could not be opened. More information: {0}

Resources.Source: The package contains a manifest that contains badly formed XML.
Resources.Translation: The package contains a manifest that contains badly formed XML.

Resources.Source: The objective must have an objectiveID attribute. Extra information: {0}
Resources.Translation: The objective must have an objectiveID attribute. Extra information: {0}

Resources.Source: The value that begins with "{0}" of the attribute, {1}, is longer than that supported by for content used in Microsoft Learning Components. It has been truncated to {2} characters. Extra information: {3}
Resources.Translation: The value that begins with "{0}" of the attribute, {1}, is longer than that supported by for content used in Microsoft Learning Components. It has been truncated to {2} characters. Extra information: {3}

Resources.Source: There are problems with the syntax of the prerequisite script, or a referenced identifier can not be found in the manifest.
Resources.Translation: There are problems with the syntax of the prerequisite script, or a referenced identifier can not be found in the manifest.

Resources.Source: The <organization> node must have an identifier attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.7, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.
Resources.Translation: The <organization> node must have an identifier attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.7, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.

Resources.Source: The file, {0}, referenced by the location element inside of metadata in the manifest contains invalid metadata.
Resources.Translation: The file, {0}, referenced by the location element inside of metadata in the manifest contains invalid metadata.

Resources.Source: The value is out of range [-1 to 1] on the <minNormalizedMeasure> node in the <{0} objectiveID="{1}"> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.7.1.1.
Resources.Translation: The value is out of range [-1 to 1] on the <minNormalizedMeasure> node in the <{0} objectiveID="{1}"> node. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.7.1.1.

Resources.Source: The <rollupAction> node is missing on an <rollupRule>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.3.
Resources.Translation: The <rollupAction> node is missing on an <rollupRule>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.3.

Resources.Source: The <sequencing> node in a <sequencingCollection> must have an ID attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.1.
Resources.Translation: The <sequencing> node in a <sequencingCollection> must have an ID attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.1.

Resources.Source: Unable to substitute a default value for the missing value of node <{0}> because the conversion process is not allowed to substitute default values for missing or erroneous values in the index.xml.
Resources.Translation: Unable to substitute a default value for the missing value of node <{0}> because the conversion process is not allowed to substitute default values for missing or erroneous values in the index.xml.

Resources.Source: The value that begins with "{0}" of the attribute, {1}, is longer than the smallest permitted maximum (SPM), {2}. Extra information: {3}
Resources.Translation: The value that begins with "{0}" of the attribute, {1}, is longer than the smallest permitted maximum (SPM), {2}. Extra information: {3}

Resources.Source: The required element, <{0}>, is missing. Default values will be used. Extra information:{1}
Resources.Translation: The required element, <{0}>, is missing. Default values will be used. Extra information:{1}

Resources.Source: The file {0} does not exist.
Resources.Translation: The file {0} does not exist.

Resources.Source: The attribute, {1}, containing the value "{0}" on node <{2}> is illegal in Resource packages.
Resources.Translation: The attribute, {1}, containing the value "{0}" on node <{2}> is illegal in Resource packages.

Resources.Source: The value must be a decimal value from 0 to 1, inclusive.
Resources.Translation: The value must be a decimal value from 0 to 1, inclusive.

Resources.Source: The <rollupConditions> node is missing on an <rollupRule>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.1.
Resources.Translation: The <rollupConditions> node is missing on an <rollupRule>. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 5.1.6.1.1.

Resources.Source: <sequencingCollection> nodes are not permitted in resource packages. This manifest is considered a resource package because it has no <organization> nodes. See SCORM CAM 3.5.3.
Resources.Translation: <sequencingCollection> nodes are not permitted in resource packages. This manifest is considered a resource package because it has no <organization> nodes. See SCORM CAM 3.5.3.

Resources.Translation: The <file> node must have an href attribute. See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.23, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.4.3.

Resources.Translation: The <title> node is missing on the <organization> node with identifier="{0}". See SCORM 1.3 CAM 3.4.1.8, or SCORM 1.2 CAM 2.3.5.3.1.1.

Resources.Translation: UA !There are multiple instances of element, <{0}>. Extra information:{1}

Resources.Translation: The "{0}" value of attribute, {1}, on element <{2}> contains spaces, which are invalid URI characters. This URI is still being allowed, but the package may not work as expected.

Resources.Translation: The file {0} is not referenced in the manifest.

Resources.Translation: The required element, <{0}>, is missing. Extra information:{1}
